skills.name: Work out the distance between two rational numbers
Know that the distance between two rational numbers is the absolute value of the difference

explanations.A: This would be the sum of the values but we want to find the positive difference as that is what the distance is!
explanations.B: To find the distance between the two values, we need to find the positive difference, as a distance cannot be negative! To do this we do the larger value - the smaller value which in this case is 2.4 - 2 1/4
explanations.C: This would give the difference between the two values but a distance cannot be negative... Distance is the positive difference so what do you need to do to your calculation to make it correct?
explanations.D: 2 1/4 is not the same as 2.4, 2 1/4 = 2.25. So, which sum gives the distance between 2 1/4 and 2.4?

explanations.A: You have correctly found the difference between the values but distance cannot be negative...
explanations.B: I think you have done 4.5 - 2.5 instead of 4.5 - -2.5. Go through 0 if it helps: how do you go from -2.5 to 0? Then how do you go from 0 to 4.5? So, how much have you gone altogether?
explanations.C: The distance between -2.5 and 4.5 is 7 as to go from -2.5 to 0 is 2.5 and to go from 0 to 4.5 is 4.5, 2.5 + 4.5 = 7! Alternatively we can do 4.5 - - 2.5 as to find the distance, we do the larger number subtract the smaller one.
